alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Lyon; Morris; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, southeastern Morris, southern Douglas, Osage and northern Lyon Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 144 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Centropolis to 3 miles west of Pomona Lake to near Dunlap. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ottawa, Osage City, Wellsville, Overbrook, Lyndon, Centropolis, Burlingame, Americus, Pomona, Scranton, Williamsburg, Quenemo, Melvern, Reading, Rantoul, Allen, Admire, Olivet, Bushong and Dunlap. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 169 and 198. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 130 and 157. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
